isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - TROUBLESHOOTING - GENERAL INFORMATION

svcprocinfo.para: When checking a problem with the manual transmission, the first thing to do is to make sure of the service condition. Talk to the driver or service manager. If possible, take the vehicle for a road test.
There are three types of problems:

svcsubproc.title: 11.1.1. Oil Leaks
svcsubproc.para: Check the transmission for transmission oil leaks. If you find oil on or under the transmission, verify that the leak is transmission oil and not engine oil, coolant or other lubricants. Note that under normal conditions, the area around the oil seal, yoke and rear bearing retainer is moist. This moist condition is not a transmission leak or an oil seal leak.

svcsubproc.title: 11.1.2. On New Transmissions
svcsubproc.para: The following conditions can be found on new transmissions and are not considered oil leaks:

item.para: Lubricants applied to the yoke during assembly can make the seal area appear moist or "leaking."
All output seals are pre-lubed with grease that melts at low temperatures. When the grease melts, it comes out of the seals, and the seals only appear to be "leaking."

svcsubproc.title: 11.1.3. Vibration
svcsubproc.para: When checking a noise or a vibration, find out when the problem occurs.

item.para: When the transmission is in NEUTRAL or in gear.
In all gears or specific gears.
In the HI range or the LO range.
In the DIR range or the OD range (Thirteen-speed transmission only).
With the vehicle loaded or unloaded.

svcsubproc.title: 11.1.4. Noise
svcsubproc.para: If a noise is the problem, find out the sound of the noise.

svcsubproc.title: 11.1.5. Operation Problems
svcsubproc.para: When the transmission is not operating correctly, find out when the problem occurs.

item.para: In the HI range or the LO range.
In the DIR range or the OD range (Thirteen-speed transmission only)

svcsubproc.para: Also, find out what the transmission does during the problem.

item.para: Does not stay in the selected gear.
Does not stay in the selected range.
